definition[0]_en: A type of binding for sheets of thick paperboard with covers that are folded and bound to form a spine.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding for sheets of thick paperboard with covers that are folded and bound to form a spine.
scope note[0]_en: The binding is durable and often used for manifestations for children. Outer covers are of the same thickness of paperboard as the sheets.

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that sews or glues sheets into sections that are glued together to form a flat spine and that are attached to endpapers which are in turn attached to a stiff outer casing.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that sews or glues sheets into sections that are glued together to form a flat spine and that are attached to endpapers which are in turn attached to a stiff outer casing.
scope note[0]_en: Sheets may be folded to form gatherings. The outer casing of the volume is usually made of board, wood, plastic, or some other rigid material.

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that uses two or more rings of metal or plastic that are threaded through holes along the edge of each sheet.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that uses two or more rings of metal or plastic that are threaded through holes along the edge of each sheet.
scope note[0]_en: The rings are widely spaced and require a spine to maintain the spacing. Outer covers may be attached directly to the spine, or threaded by the rings.

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that uses multiple closely-spaced curved flaps of metal or plastic that are threaded through holes along the edge of each sheet.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that uses multiple closely-spaced curved flaps of metal or plastic that are threaded through holes along the edge of each sheet.
scope note[0]_en: The binding flaps usually form a curved spine. Outer covers are generally threaded by the flaps.

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that uses two or more rings of metal or plastic that are threaded through holes along the edge of each sheet, and that can be opened to allow the removal or insertion of any sheet.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that uses two or more rings of metal or plastic that are threaded through holes along the edge of each sheet, and that can be opened to allow the removal or insertion of any sheet.
scope note[0]_en: The rings are widely spaced and require a spine to maintain the spacing. Outer covers may be attached directly to the spine or threaded by the rings.

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that glues sheets together and to a flexible outer casing to form a spine.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that glues sheets together and to a flexible outer casing to form a spine.
scope note[0]_en: Sheets may be folded to form gatherings. The outer casing of the volume is usually made of thin card, plastic, or some other flexible material.

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that folds sheets and staples them along the fold to form a spine.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that folds sheets and staples them along the fold to form a spine.
scope note[0]_en: The staples may be made of metal, plastic, or textile. Outer covers made of a flexible material are also folded and stapled to the sheets.

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that uses a single length of metal or plastic bent into a C cross-section which slides over the edge of each sheet to hold it in place.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that uses a single length of metal or plastic bent into a C cross-section which slides over the edge of each sheet to hold it in place.
scope note[0]_en: Outer covers of the volume may be made of a thin flexible material that can be inserted as a sheet into the binding strip.

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that uses a continuous wire or plastic coil that is threaded through holes along the edge of each sheet.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that uses a continuous wire or plastic coil that is threaded through holes along the edge of each sheet.
scope note[0]_en: Outer covers of the volume may be made of a rigid or flexible material, and may be attached directly to the coil or threaded by the coil

definition[0]_en: A type of binding that clamps the edge of each sheet in a metal spring that is directly attached to a spine and outer covers, and that can be opened to allow the removal or insertion of any sheet.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A type of binding that clamps the edge of each sheet in a metal spring that is directly attached to a spine and outer covers, and that can be opened to allow the removal or insertion of any sheet.
